Presenting Problem / Chief Complaint: The patient expresses a desire to improve self-esteem and confidence in social situations, mentioning challenges faced in communication with their children and the impact on their feelings
History of Present Illness (HPI): The patient discusses various challenges, including difficulties in expressing feelings to their children, feelings of disappointment, and negative self-perceptions related to their job and parenting. They acknowledge the struggle to challenge these negative thoughts but recognize the importance of positive feedback received from others
Therapeutic Interventions: The patient has engaged in journaling and walking as coping strategies, and they plan to create visual reminders of positive affirmations to combat negative thoughts
Next Steps: The patient intends to focus on love in future conversations with their children, join a local group or class to build confidence, and set a goal to attend one class this month, ensuring they support themselves through nervousness
